structure.unit: COUNTIES, CITIES, AND OTHER LOCAL UNITS

law.catch_line: Lien of local government for fines and penalties -- Effect on rights of secured parties.

text.section: The local government shall possess a lien on property for all fines, penalties, charges, abatement costs, and fees imposed pursuant to KRS 82.700 to 82.725. The lien shall be superior to and have priority over all other liens on the property, except state, county, school board, and city taxes.
Nothing in KRS 82.700 to 82.725 shall otherwise affect the rights or obligations between the owner of the property and those persons who claim a security interest in the property.

law.history: Amended 2011 Ky. Acts ch. 95, sec. 8, effective June 8, 2011. -- Created 1992 Ky. Acts ch. 349, sec. 5, effective July 14, 1992.
